chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Griffin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP.
Consecutive to: Current sentence
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith Griffin Jr

records.addlTxt:
8:54 AM Defendant Keith Griffin Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Keith Griffin Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Matter set as a status but parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Ct 2 without repeater, Ct 4- GUILTY. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: Ct 2 without repeater, Ct 4 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 4 months RCJ concurrent to each other but consecutive to current sentence. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.
$Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, costs reduced to judgment. 

Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP.

9:50 AM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keith Griffin Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Keith Griffin Jr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keith Griffin Jr not in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant refused to appear today.
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits. Matter adjourned
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's NOI to Introduce Certd Public Records
State's NOI to Intro Expert Testimony
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keith Griffin Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Keith Griffin Jr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
